title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs to be improved
description: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The error message is 'Source page is dirty.' This behavior is confusing for users as it does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes. Additionally, the dialog box that appears is titled 'Error'.
OB: The 'Dirty Page' behavior in the XML Report Designer editor occurs when the user edits the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then tries to switch back to the Layout view. The error message 'Source page is dirty' is displayed, but it does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
EB: To improve the 'Dirty Page' behavior in the XML Report Designer editor, clearer instructions should be provided to the user on how to save or discard the changes when attempting to switch back to the Layout view from the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
SR:
1. Modify the error message to provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
2. Rename the dialog box from 'Error' to a more descriptive title.
